channel.title: Peter Brown
channel.description:
Peter Brown is a maker exploring resin, wood and chasing inspiration. He's a part time YouTuber whose main goal is satisfying his own curiosities. He started off as pen turner but after years of production work he burned out, and now he just tries to make things that make him happy. You can find him on YouTube, Instagram and Facebook.
I'll try my best to make something interesting. This is just for fun, please don't do what I do in the shop.
All of the content shown is for the sole purpose of entertainment and is not intended for educational purposes in any format. Anyone choosing of their own free will to reenact or recreate any of this content assumes all personal liability and or responsibility by doing so. Woodworking especially with power tools is very dangerous and can cause serious bodily harm, therefore proper education and training are advised.
Mailing Address:
Peter Brown P.O. Box 2870 Santa Rosa, Ca 95405

item.title: How To Make An Oval Table
item.description:
Duration: 05:33 (333s)
Views: 54334

Table built from recycled crib slats and black plumbing pipe.

item.title: How To Make A Wooden Compass
item.description:
Duration: 04:40 (280s)
Views: 75897
Likes: 675
Built a wooden compass from some scrap cherry and some extra hardware I had around the shop.

item.title: Industrial Aluminum Table
item.description:
Duration: 05:28 (328s)
Views: 33854
Likes: 423
Table made from a discarded oak pedestal and a scrap piece of aluminum that was bolted to my old drill press.

item.title: How To Make A Pear Bowl
item.description:
Duration: 05:12 (312s)
Views: 41115
Likes: 411
This is a small hunk of pear crotch with a large crack and exposed bark. The green wood was rough turned in July, it has dried enough for a final turning.
Totally size was about 7" or so. Finished with shellac

item.title: Restored Walnut & Stone Table
item.description:
Duration: 04:59 (299s)
Views: 18885
Likes: 331
This was a roadside freebie. I took it apart and found a beautiful stone and walnut entry table. Finished with tung oil and the top with a touch of mineral oil for shine.

item.title: How To Make A Wine Bottle Light
item.description:
Duration: 05:06 (306s)
Views: 319694
Likes: 1760
I turned a discarded cherry base and a pardon tequila bottle...scratch that, old wine bottle, into a bottle light.
It warms up the room and is a great use for otherwise discarded items.

item.title: How To Make A Walnut Wall Clock
item.description:
Duration: 04:22 (262s)
Views: 42563
Likes: 423
This is a turned walnut clock with just a hint of geek. I made this from a board of curly black walnut and a microwaved optical disk.
Finished with a bit of wipe on polyurethane.

item.title: How To Make A Walnut Tippie Top
item.description:
Duration: 02:36 (156s)
Views: 75979
Likes: 519
Wooden Tippy Top from claro walnut. Give it a spin and watch it flip over on it's head.
I turned this fairly quick and played with it non stop for the next few days!

item.title: How To Make Half Lap Pine Legs
item.description:
Duration: 03:56 (236s)
Views: 6052
Likes: 126
A set of pine legs for an oval table. Jointery cut o the band saw then completed at the bench with chisels.
My chisel work needs improvement

item.title: How To Make A French Clip Barrette
item.description:
Duration: 04:48 (288s)
Views: 30236
Likes: 338
Made some french clip barrettes. They are laminated from re-sawn mulberry, dogwood, sycamore, claro walnut and leftover pine just to class it up.
Barrettes clips purchased here: https://www.etsy.com/listing/54711698/12-wide-french-style-hair-barrette-clips

item.title: How To Make A Simple Resaw Fence
item.description:
Duration: 02:00 (120s)
Views: 23382
Likes: 186
I make a simple resaw fence for the band saw, and it works great. You can make one too, in under 20 minutes.

item.title: How To Make A Wooden Travel Mug
item.description:
Duration: 04:21 (261s)
Views: 201345
Likes: 1885
This travel mug was turned from a hunk of walnut burl that was literally found on the side of the road. I was surprised by what I found once cut on the band saw.
This was finished with 4 coats of wipe on polyurethane and buffed out to a satin shine.

item.title: Tiki Carving
item.description:
Duration: 04:12 (252s)
Views: 25064
Likes: 273
This is my first time carving. The wood is pear and it is still pretty green. I carve a Tiki and then discover a better use for it. Not all projects are successes. That's OK...
I still had a good time.

item.title: How To Make A Pumpkin Candle Holder
item.description:
Duration: 03:50 (230s)
Views: 19076
Likes: 279
Just in time for Halloween, this is a pumpkin candle holder. Turned from pear, it should age to a deep orange in a couple of weeks.
The outside was shaped with files and finished with a coat of poly for shine

item.title: Pendulum Wave
item.description:
Duration: 03:37 (217s)
Views: 94316
Likes: 1342
So I saw this pendulum wave video on YouTube and thought, "I wonder if I could make that?" It's a scrap wood project and entirely for my own amusement.
I used a 1" dowel, a couple of cedar boards, and some network patch cable. I spent about an hour last night just setting off, over and over and over again. It is quite hypnotic...

item.title: How To Make A Wooden Foot Massager
item.description:
Duration: 03:28 (208s)
Views: 29357
Likes: 293
Wooden Foot Massager.
This is a skew chisel only project, and a fairly simple one. You could just as easily do this with a spindle gouge if you prefer. This blank is from a leftover piece of stair banister and has a good weight to it.
Finished with shellac and smelly sock....

item.title: Bar Stools
item.description:
Duration: 03:48 (228s)
Views: 24209
Likes: 353
I found a free set of chairs on CL. They were in bad shape having been left outside. They were de-laminating pretty badly.
Here's a glimpse at their shop time and the new lease on life

item.title: Mistakes
item.description:
Duration: 01:37 (97s)
Views: 21228
Likes: 433
Look we all make mistakes, it's part of life. It's just I happen to have mine on film.
Enjoy my goof ups, and be careful out there in the shop...

item.title: Shop Maintenance
item.description:
Duration: 05:38 (338s)
Views: 10133
Likes: 143
Our tools are like children and so they yearn for our attention...
Since I'm in between projects I thought I'd give you a glimpse at few of my many maintenance routines.
If you have any question on the specifics, be sure to ask.

item.title: How To Make A Photo Light Box
item.description:
Duration: 03:42 (222s)
Views: 8838
Likes: 149
A light box is invaluable if you will be selling your items online. A good picture will put a seller at ease. So if you want to make a simple one for the cost of tape, a cardboard box and tissue paper then follow along.
Mine is small but you can adjust the size to suit your needs...

item.title: How To Make A Cornhole Game With Printed Logo
item.description:
Duration: 04:16 (256s)
Views: 43025
Likes: 243
I was asked to make a set of cornhole boards by my brother-in-law, for his youth group. The base construction is very simple, but I wanted to be clever and use his groups logo on the board itself. This operation was a bit more tricky than I first expected.
Oh, and you finally get to see what I spend most of my time doing. Looking for my shop pencil!

item.title: How To Make A Round Pencil Drawer
item.description:
Duration: 03:27 (207s)
Views: 149537
Likes: 1847
I made a drawer for the one thing I'm always losing in the shop.
It's just a 1" dowel, with a channel and a turned pull. I drilled out a 35mm hole and now I'll always know where to find my pencil.

item.title: Dumb Science Tricks: Milk & Popcorn
item.description:
Duration: 01:37 (97s)
Views: 204452
Likes: 1423
So here is strange little filler video I made with two full glasses of matter. One with milk and one with popcorn. The volume of one is emptied into the other without any overflow. How?
Yeah, I really just got bored one night...
I emailed by Derek @ Veritasium, his idea was that in all reality its only about 30 kernels or so. Try adding 30 dry kernels to a glass of milk, nothing much is going to happen...

item.title: How To Make A Wooden Speaker
item.description:
Duration: 05:47 (347s)
Views: 950622
Likes: 9007
I made a passive acoustic speaker for my iPhone out of walnut.
It is made in the same method as a band saw box. The longest part was trying to sharpen my carving tools...

item.title: How To Make Turned Door Stops
item.description:
Duration: 05:05 (305s)
Views: 76479
Likes: 592
A set of turned doorstops. They are glued up from a few cherry and walnut leftovers.
I turn them on the lathe and cut them up at the band saw. I've tested them out. They do in fact stop doors...

item.title: How To Make A Glass Bottle Bird Feeder
item.description:
Duration: 04:57 (297s)
Views: 150078
Likes: 1647
My wife saw one similar on Pintrest and tasked me to make one. It came out great!
The bottle was a $1 from the local thrift store and is needed first to get the dimension for the rest of the project. I used cypress as the base wood and hard maple as the accent. The hardest part was trying to clamp up that back piece...

item.title: How To Make A Pencil Spin Top
item.description:
Duration: 03:55 (235s)
Views: 88751
Likes: 673
This is a piece of sycamore turned to a top shape. You then insert a pencil and spin it up. I used 1/4 copper collars to give the pencil a tight grip.
It draws cool circles and shortening or lengthening the pencil will give it different paths as it alters the center of gravity.

item.title: How To Make An Etched Pint Glass
item.description:
Duration: 03:59 (239s)
Views: 158075
Likes: 1969
I etched a Batman logo in a pint glass. I used a product called Armour Etch, and within an hour was drink a brew to sooth my gravely voice.
Not the pint glass you deserve, but the one you need. Happy 75th Birthday Batman!

item.title: How To Make A Star Wars Desk Ornament
item.description:
Duration: 03:46 (226s)
Views: 30169
Likes: 359
I turn a Star Wars candy dispenser into a sage desk ornament. Master Yoda's wisdom should not be discarded so readily..
The wood is claro walnut with a wipe on poly finish.
If you listen closely you can hear Capt. Janeway giving orders in the background...

item.title: Skew Chisel Practice
item.description:
Duration: 02:35 (155s)
Views: 14905
Likes: 137
I've found a lot of wood turners who are uncomfortable with the skew.
This is just a quick video with some tips I've learned from turning with my skew. It's my go to chisel for spindles and I love the surface I can get right from the tool.
I would urge you all to give it a bit of practice, and see what a sharp skew can do for you.

item.title: How To Make A Star Wars Wall Clock
item.description:
Duration: 04:30 (270s)
Views: 49480
Likes: 632
This is my Star Wars wall clock. It is in the shape of the rebel alliance symbol. made from walnut and maple, then cut out on the band saw, and begrudgingly shaped and sanded for hours at my work bench.
I finished it with wipe on poly, I find myself humming "The Throne Room Theme" http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BjDaPOWdx6s as I check the time....

item.title: Confessions of a Wood Hoarder
item.description:
Duration: 05:55 (355s)
Views: 66906
Likes: 1305
I am a wood hoarder. I collect nice wood and pretend that some day I'm going to put it to good use. I might...
Watch me share some of my stash and talk about this strange obsession. I think we're all like this to some extent!
Comment, Share and Subscribe!

Steampunk desk lamp. Jatoba (Brasilian cherry), plywood and pipe cobbled together for a little industrial illumination.

item.description:
Duration: 05:46 (346s)

A bracelet turned from a recycled part of old blue jeans. These jeans of mine had seen better days, but with a little epoxy and a quick turn on the lathe, I turn them into something unique!
I originally sprayed it with lacquer, but it just wasn't right. So I sanded it off and left it unfinished. The patterns that you get from the layers of denim is quite interesting!
Pocket83: https://www.youtube.com/user/pocket83

item.description:
Duration: 07:39 (459s)
Views: 514866
Likes: 4269
I make a Star Trek LED light from walnut and acrylic. Add some electronics and you've got a one of a kind desk light, or night light! It's also modular so you can update it whenever it strikes your fancy!
Finished with wipe on poly and acrylic shined with a spot of windex...
DIY Perks Shard Light: http://youtu.be/kgPghSJhkzU

item.title: Shop Talk: Favorite Tool
item.description:
Duration: 04:09 (249s)

Likes: 589
Do you have a favorite power tool? I do! Come spend some time talking tools and let me know "Do you you have a favorite tool?"

item.title: How To Make A Desk Magnifying Glass
item.description:
Duration: 04:29 (269s)
Views: 736144
Likes: 4591
An epoxy poured magnifying glass. I take a thrift store spoon rest and turn into something useful and interesting for your desk.
If you have a couple hours to spare, you can do the same!
Epoxy Essentials: http://astore.amazon.com/shotim0a-20?_encoding=UTF8&node=2
For this project I would recommend a clear mix like the Castn' Craft Product. It's easy to use and you can buy it in small amounts.

item.title: How To Make A Tool Handle
item.description:
Duration: 03:28 (208s)
Views: 22954
Likes: 311
While completing my current project I got a nasty catch and broke my bowl gouge handle, thus escalating THIS project to the top of the pile.
This was completed in under 30 minutes! A quick 16" ash tool handle finished with boiled linseed oil and ready to be put to work!
Thanks for watching!

item.title: How To Make A Copper Etched Box
item.description:
Duration: 10:26 (626s)
Views: 340414
Likes: 2668
This is a walnut and copper etched box. The copper is etched with a simple salt water etching technique you can replicate. I turn the box on the lathe and finish it with 2 coats of wipe on poly.
Green Lantern logo optional...
Robbie The Woodturner https://www.youtube.com/user/Robbiethewoodturner

item.title: How To Make A Paper Towel Holder
item.description:
Duration: 06:11 (371s)
Views: 43379
Likes: 688
A domestic request! Ash and plywood paper towel holder, finished with enamel!
This is a simple project, but dead useful. I really like the plywood lamination, but it is a bit more work during the sanding section.
Plus a follow up on the copper etched box!

item.title: The Confetti Blank
item.description:
Duration: 05:01 (301s)
Views: 425358
Likes: 4666
The life and wisdom of the Glorious Confetti Blank
In my city fireworks are illegal, so the best fun a person can hope for on the 4th of July is some BBQ and confetti poppers. Since my floor was littered in the stuff, I thought I might try and put it to some good use...

item.title: How To Make A Wooden Spin Top
item.description:
Duration: 05:44 (344s)
Views: 346042
Likes: 2010
Sycamore wood turned into a classic wooden spin top. I thought vintage toys we're suppose to be easy to use?!
Amish Man Making Spin Top - http://youtu.be/tgpqO7zStvc Carl Jacobson Maple Spin Top - http://youtu.be/JOv1Jm1-cds

item.title: How To Make A Confetti Tippe Top
item.description:
Duration: 03:53 (233s)
Views: 111207
Likes: 1223
Confetti blank take two! This time I turn another tippe top. A very satisfying little toy. Give it a spin and watch it flip over on it's head!
The original idea was to use nails as the stems for tippe tops and shape them on the belt sander with my hand drill. I had hoped to do a production run of tippe tops this way and make a cool video in the process. The thing about new ideas is not all of them work. Anyone need a much of walnut squares with nails epoxied in?
Walnut Tippe Top: http://youtu.be/24ApXC7iabE Pencil Spin Top: http://youtu.be/FDLpzenoEkA Sycamore Spin Top: http://youtu.be/E_oAoQLpIBw

item.title: How To Make A Tablet Stand From a Book
item.description:
Duration: 04:34 (274s)
Views: 156646
Likes: 2912
Tablet stand made from a 400 page book and some epoxy resin. Paper micarta is the proper term for it, but it doesn't really capture the essence of the idea. Those 400 pages hold but a single story, and now they can upright a device capable of holding thousands of stories.
Really it's the ultimate upcycling!
And with only a book and 30 some odd ounces of epoxy, you can make your own!
Please like and share!

item.title: How To Make A Wooden Chakram. Circle of Death
item.description:
Duration: 08:00 (480s)
Views: 1149344
Likes: 9988
A wooden Chakram made from maple and mercilessly hurled in the oncoming enemy hordes...
The famous death circle of the Sikhs, and also wielded by Xena Warrior Princess in the late 1990's. Mine is made from maple and finished boiled linseed oil for an easy to renew finish.
If you round the edge over it then becomes a wooden AerobieÂ®! It actually flew quite nicely!

item.description:
Duration: 02:00 (120s)
Views: 16372

Take a couple of minutes doing some basic maintenance on your drill press. Keeping tools running well will result in more productive and also more enjoyable time in the shop!

item.title: How To Make an Ironwood Wand
item.description:
Duration: 04:58 (298s)
Views: 119876
Likes: 1449
Making an ironwood wand. Ironwood is extremely hard type of wood. It is normally heavy, oily and due to the high silica content quite rough on the tools. All that being said, if you take your time and work hard to get it all polished up it is a beautiful looking wood. This wand is laminated with a 1/4 piece of oak and finished with a coat of wipe on poly.
Also, 'iron' woods are the only woods that are heavy enough to sink in water.
Science lesson over, lets turn a wand...
Please like and share!
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kludge1977 Twitter: https://twitter.com/kludge1977 ShopTime Blog: http://www.shoptimeshow.com Pinterest: http://www.pinterest.com/kludge77

item.description:
Duration: 08:06 (486s)

This is a free floating TARDIS desk ornament. It hangs suspended in time and space as if flying in the time vortex. Perhaps off to some Dalek infested back alley somewhere in Cardiff...
Made with walnut, maple and 4 rare earth magnets, this is fun build in anticipation of the 8th season of Doctor Who from the BBC. ~~

item.title: How to Make A Copper Penny Serving Tray
item.description:
Duration: 06:26 (386s)
Views: 505760
Likes: 7645
Restoration projects can be very fun. Taking something with little value and modifying it. I take a garage sale TV tray and add 391 pennies, epoxy and a 12" length of copper pipe. No table saw, no band saw and no lathe. This is a basic build project!
Watch for googly eyes...

item.title: How To Make An Ice Cream Pint Lock
item.description:
Duration: 04:57 (297s)
Views: 371076
Likes: 5659
I make a lock for my pint of rocky road ice cream to keep unwanted spoons at bay. This is made with maple, a small brass hinge and the padlock of your choosing!
What I'm doing is similar to rapid prototyping. So while not all projects come out like the vision in my head, I have to say I'm pleased with this idea's physical form and really like the outrageous look of that old school padlock.

item.title: How To Make A Wooden Rope Puzzle
item.description:
Duration: 05:00 (300s)
Views: 750205
Likes: 3020
I made a run of these two ring puzzles about three years ago, and they were quite popular as gifts. The joy is, once you know the secret, you want to watch others labor over it. Turns out we're all sickos....
I recently saw Steve French's video on his two string puzzle and that reminded me of this project. Head over and see Steve's video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P-rHx1DRABs

item.title: How To Recycle HDPE Plastic The Easy Way
item.description:
Duration: 04:12 (252s)
Views: 2579230
Likes: 29701
Turning old milk jugs and bottle caps into useable stock for making. In this short video I process a 2 milk bottles and about half a dozen bottle tops into a 1 1/2" x 2" x 5" turning block.
You just as easily press this into sheet material for use in box inlays or scroll saw art. The possibilities are endless. The total processing time was under an hour from bottle to blank! Less than waiting for a glue up.
The result is a stunningly colorful blank!

item.title: How To Make A Retro HDPE Wall Clock
item.description:
Duration: 04:45 (285s)
Views: 64113
Likes: 995
My main motivation was to try something different with the HDPE than just turning it on the lathe. I wanted to incorporate it into a traditional woodworking piece as a accent.
This is a maple and jatoba wall clock with 4 -1" HDPE inlays. The style has a retro feel to it that the colors help to sell.
It was great in theory, but proved quite tricky in actual application. Next time, I'd just screw in the HDPE from the back and plug those hole with a dowel, instead of trying to be all clever....
I've got some more idea for using this material in non-conventional ways, so hopefully this will not be the last of my HDPE experiments...

item.title: How To Make A Death Star Christmas Ornament
item.description:
Duration: 04:25 (265s)
Views: 65751
Likes: 1139
Sure there are lots of iconic and memorable films out there, but when is the last one that actually change your outlook on the world? Every man I've ever met has had a secret fantasy that some old codger would find him one day, hand him a laser sword and explain he was the last person in the galaxy with the ability to save the universe from total destruction.
That's what Star Wars is to me. A boyhood fantasy complete with blasters and Jedi mind tricks.
More detail can be seen on my website below!
It's ready to hang on your tree. Or not. I'm really not sure if it's smart to hang a wooden ornament with a light stuck in it on my Christmas tree. I'm sure something will tell me....

item.title: Recycle Old PVC Into Flat Sheets
item.description:
Duration: 03:12 (192s)
Views: 337254
Likes: 3337
When you think about PVC, you're probably like me, and consider it as a tube. Well, it's pretty easy to get it into flat material for the shop. I flattened a 4" piece of schedule 40 PVC in about 20 minutes. You just need a heat gun and a flat surface.
Odds are, you've got loads of the stuff sitting around the house. Why not recycle it into something useful?
Stain PVC Any Color: http://makezine.com/projects/make-30/stain-pvc-any-color-you-like/

item.title: Dip It #2 : Epoxy vs Oreo!
item.description:
Duration: 07:22 (442s)
Views: 948545
Likes: 11846
This Dip It was 4 months in the makings, but worth the wait! It's a simply bonkers idea. Oreo encased resin cake stand.
The epoxy I used is not rated for sustained food contact, so simply add a piece of wax paper under you cake.
The top measures 11" in diameter and it's about 5" high. Also the resin top is not secured to the base to allow each piece to be used individually as well!
If you like this, please share it. If it does well, I'll keep making quick epoxy dipping projects in addition to my other projects.
Full Write up: https://shop-time.net/oreo-cookie-cake-stand/

item.title: Resin Magnifying Lens vs. Sun
item.description:
Duration: 03:15 (195s)
Views: 81899
Likes: 2163
We had a couple hours of sunlight this last weekend and I was able to test my last project: Resin Lens https://youtu.be/8qgzjJ16u5I
It was a huge success, and easily burned through shop towels and craft paper. Getting that footage on camera...well it was a bit more of a trick. Even with a polarizing filter on my camera lens it was hard to get a clear view of the blinding light.
Oh, and *Please don't try this at home*

item.title: The Herringbone Dilemma
item.description:
Duration: 09:10 (550s)
Views: 621614
Likes: 8959
I take a walnut board and make it into a large blank for a turned box.
The end grain herringbone pattern is achieved by cross-cutting 2" lengths from a 13"x11" walnut board and stacking them on end, to make something quite dramatic looking from a fairly common board!
Be sure to vote: Team Cutting Board Or Team Box?!
I will check the comments Saturday night, Jan 9th 2016 for a final tally. The choice of what I make, lies with you!

The final dimensions of this box are 5 inches in diameter and 2 inches high. I used two coats of boiled linseed oil as the finish, and it gives the box a very warm feel.

item.title: Using Resin As A Cleaner?
item.description:
Duration: 01:57 (117s)
Views: 1568420
Likes: 17128
So this might not be the most cost effective cleaning solution, but I really really wanted to try it anyway. So here's to a $12 experiment...
Before you ask: I had tried this a while back with some old wood glue and it didn't stick to anything on mat, so I thought I'd give the experiment another try with resin. The resin was much more effective! The only thing it missed, was a bit of silicone molding material, so I scraped it off with a wooden stir stick...

item.description:
Duration: 11:15 (675s)
Views: 880100
Likes: 16903
Micarta is made from layers of paper or fabric and resin. This pen is actually made out of paper. 20 layers of cardstock cut into 1" squares and then glued into a pen blank.
It was then turned on the wood lathe and assembled into a pen kit. I love the colors, the material and having a useful item that started it's life as paper...

item.title: Steel & Redwood Hammock Stand
item.description:
Duration: 10:04 (604s)
Views: 230506
Likes: 8015
I picked up the steel at a local salvage yard and the redwood fence posts at the Home Depot. The majority of the time spent on this project was me screwing up the nerve to start welding.
I'm a fan of MIG love the sound and thoroughly enjoyed melting metal in the shop! I guarantee you will see more of this.
Mrs. Brown was huge in helping me finalize the joining method with the carpenter shims and the leveling feet. She was the voice of reason, to keep me from freaking out at the last mile.
As I know someone will ask. Evolution sent me a saw last year, and Hobart sent me a welder. No one paid me to make this video and I purchased the steel for the welding table, gas for the welder and the cart to set it all on. If either of them does sponsor an episode, I will disclose that in the video.

item.title: Epoxy Art: Painting With Resin!
item.description:
Duration: 10:55 (655s)
Views: 596818
Likes: 20209
Painting with resin isn't a new technique but it was a first for me. It is a very relaxing and enjoyable process. I love the way the colors flow into each other.
I tried tipping and the propane torch but I found for me the heat gun was the easiest method that yielded the best results. I know this will not be my last piece of resin wall art and I would encourage anyone wanting to make art to try this method.

item.title: Rainbow Cotton Ball Handle
item.description:
Duration: 07:29 (449s)
Views: 233746
Likes: 11971
After the last cotton ball project, I really wanted to try dying the cotton. I also used a higher resin to cotton ratio to really get it to soak into the fibers.
I love the material, and how the dye brings a depth to the cotton that is much harder to see in the non-dyed version. Overall, I feel there are still loads of possibilities for this material. I doubt I'm done with it.

item.title: Brass & Resin Table
item.description:
Duration: 11:46 (706s)
Views: 454337
Likes: 13464
Total Boat Resin: https://www.totalboat.com/PeterBrown
~~~ In July of 2018 a viewer sent me out a bag full of brass shavings after he watched my aluminum shaving bowl video. I thought it would be really fun to try this combo as a table top.
I also got a chance to give my welder another workout. I have to save, between the largest resin pour I've ever done and my first crack at wielding a table leg, I am very happy with how this all turned out.
Since the pigment I used is slightly transparent you really get a cool depth to this project. I sort of get lost staring at the patterns.

item.title: Scrap Plywood To Copper Pendant
item.description:
Duration: 08:37 (517s)
Views: 291675
Likes: 12329
Electroforming is the process by which a thin copper veneer is added to a non-metallic object by means of electricity and a conductive solution.
Honestly, I understand how it works, it still feels like actual magic. At least low-level alchemy. Also, it's fun and quite doable in a small shop.

item.description:
Duration: 03:12 (192s)

In the last video, there were a lot of comments from people who wanted to see a time-lapse video. That's what this is.
Normally I would leave the flamingo in the bath for 3-4 hours to get a nice solid copper coating as I achieved in the last video. One hour and 20 minutes gave me 50Gigs of footage. That's plenty for me... :)

Duration: 12:05 (725s)

Wine corks macerated in a blender, mixed with copious volumes of resin and poured into a 2-liter bottle then cooked under pressure for 3 days straight. Just like granny used to make...

The lady I sold then it to wanted them to help her back. She said they were a good height for her.
I first found this and posted in 2020 on Instagram. Back then I asked the bookstore owner where he got the chairs. He said he found them both for sale years ago in a local thrift store. Was in the shop again last night and now only one remains.
Obviously they didn't help her back much. :)
